00041   enum GuiMode
00042     {
00043       GM_Game,          // Game mode, only HUD
00044       GM_Inventory,     // Inventory mode
00045       GM_MainMenu,      // Main menu mode
00046 
00047       GM_Console,       // Console mode
00048 
00049       // None of the following are implemented yet
00050 
00051       GM_Dialogue,      // NPC interaction
00052       GM_Barter,
00053       GM_Rest,
00054       // .. more here ..
00055 
00056       // Startup character creation dialogs
00057       GM_Name,
00058       GM_Race,
00059       GM_Birth,
00060       GM_Class,
00061       GM_Review
00062     };
00063 
00064   // Windows shown in inventory mode
00065   enum GuiWindow
00066     {
00067       GW_None           = 0,
00068 
00069       GW_Map            = 0x01,
00070       GW_Inventory      = 0x02,
00071       GW_Magic          = 0x04,
00072       GW_Stats          = 0x08,
00073 
00074       GW_ALL            = 0xFF
00075     };
00076 
00077   class WindowManager
00078   {
00079     HUD *hud;
00080     MapWindow *map;
00081     MainMenu *menu;
00082     StatsWindow *stats;
00083     Console *console;
00084 
00085     MyGUI::Gui *gui;
00086 
00087     // Current gui mode
00088     GuiMode mode;
00089 
00090     // Currently shown windows in inventory mode
00091     GuiWindow shown;
00092 
00093     /* Currently ALLOWED windows in inventory mode. This is used at
00094        the start of the game, when windows are enabled one by one
00095        through script commands. You can manipulate this through using
00096        allow() and disableAll().
00097 
00098        The setting should also affect visibility of certain HUD
00099        elements, but this is not done yet.
00100      */
00101     GuiWindow allowed;
00102 
00103     // Update visibility of all windows based on mode, shown and
00104     // allowed settings.
00105     void updateVisible();
00106 
00107   public:
00109     WindowManager(MyGUI::Gui *_gui, MWWorld::Environment& environment,
00110         const Compiler::Extensions& extensions, bool newGame);
00111     virtual ~WindowManager();
00112 
00113     void setMode(GuiMode newMode)
00114     {
00115       if (newMode==GM_Inventory && allowed==GW_None)
00116         return;
00117 
00118       mode = newMode;
00119       updateVisible();
00120     }
00121 
00122     GuiMode getMode() const { return mode; }
00123 
00124     // Everything that is not game mode is considered "gui mode"
00125     bool isGuiMode() const { return getMode() != GM_Game; }
00126 
00127     // Disallow all inventory mode windows
00128     void disallowAll()
00129     {
00130       allowed = GW_None;
00131       updateVisible();
00132     }
00133 
00134     // Allow one or more windows
00135     void allow(GuiWindow wnd)
00136     {
00137       allowed = (GuiWindow)(allowed | wnd);
00138       updateVisible();
00139     }
00140 
00141     MyGUI::Gui* getGui() const { return gui; }
00142 
00143     void setValue (const std::string& id, const MWMechanics::Stat<int>& value);
00145 
00146     void setValue (const std::string& id, const MWMechanics::DynamicStat<int>& value);
00148 
00149     void messageBox (const std::string& message, const std::vector<std::string>& buttons);
00150   };
00151 }
